intro: Dianthus spurius, commonly known as the common campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a reddish or purplish hue. Its flowers are pink to red, with five petals and prominent white or pale pink markings. Dianthus spurius is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry meadows.
